Name: Shark's Tooth No.1 (Trader Vic's)
Ingredients: 10 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Sling glass .
Save spent lime shell from juicing for garnish.
STRAIN into ice-filled glass whilst also pouring soda water.
Review: Pinky red in colour and heavily influenced by flavoursome overproof rum.
History: Adapted from Victor Bergeron 's Trader Vic's 1972 Bartender's Guide (revised edition) where he writes, "One of the first drinks we ever made".
Nutrition: One serving of Shark's Tooth No.1 (Trader Vic's) contains 148 calories
